mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 54.8
1. One Thing
The Simile of the Lamp

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an8.63:3.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti bahulīkato, tato tvaṁ, bhikkhu, imaṁ samādhiṁ savitakkampi savicāraṁ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkampi vicāramattaṁ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkampi avicāraṁ bhāveyyāsi, sappītikampi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikampi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatampi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatampi bhāveyyāsi.
an8.63:3.1.en: When this immersion is developed and cultivated in this way, you should develop it while placing the mind and keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind or keeping it connected. You should develop it with rapture. You should develop it without rapture. You should develop it with pleasure. You should develop it with equanimity.

an8.63:4.1.pli: Yato kho, te bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato te, bhikkhu, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
an8.63:4.1.en: When this immersion is well developed in this way, you should train like this:

an8.63:5.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato tvaṁ, bhikkhu, imaṁ samādhiṁ savitakkasavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkavicāramattampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkaavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, sappītikampi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikampi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatampi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatampi bhāveyyāsi.
an8.63:5.1.en: When this immersion is well developed in this way, you should develop it while placing the mind and keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind or keeping it connected. You should develop it with rapture. You should develop it without rapture. You should develop it with pleasure. You should develop it with equanimity.

an8.63:6.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato te, bhikkhu, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
an8.63:6.1.en: When this immersion is well developed in this way, you should train like this:

an8.63:7.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti bahulīkato, tato tvaṁ, bhikkhu, imaṁ samādhiṁ savitakkasavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkavicāramattampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkaavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, sappītikampi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikampi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatampi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatampi bhāveyyāsi.
an8.63:7.1.en: When this immersion is developed and cultivated in this way, you should develop it while placing the mind and keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind or keeping it connected. You should develop it with rapture. You should develop it without rapture. You should develop it with pleasure. You should develop it with equanimity.

an8.63:8.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato te, bhikkhu, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
an8.63:8.1.en: When this immersion is well developed in this way, you should train like this:

an8.63:9.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti bahulīkato, tato tvaṁ, bhikkhu, imaṁ samādhiṁ savitakkasavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkavicāramattampi bhāveyyāsi, avitakkaavicārampi bhāveyyāsi, sappītikampi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikampi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatampi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatampi bhāveyyāsi.
an8.63:9.1.en: When this immersion is developed and cultivated in this way, you should develop it while placing the mind and keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. You should develop it without placing the mind or keeping it connected. You should develop it with rapture. You should develop it without rapture. You should develop it with pleasure. You should develop it with equanimity.

an8.63:10.1.pli: Yato kho te, bhikkhu, ayaṁ samādhi evaṁ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato tvaṁ, bhikkhu, yena yeneva gagghasi phāsuṁyeva gagghasi, yattha yattha ṭhassasi phāsuṁyeva ṭhassasi, yattha yattha nisīdissasi phāsuṁyeva nisīdissasi, yattha yattha seyyaṁ kappessasi phāsuṁyeva seyyaṁ kappessasī”ti.
an8.63:10.1.en: When this immersion is well developed in this way, wherever you walk, you’ll walk comfortably. Wherever you stand, you’ll stand comfortably. Wherever you sit, you’ll sit comfortably. Wherever you lie down, you’ll lie down comfortably.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 8.63
7. Earthquakes
A Teaching in Brief

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.27:1.4.pli: ‘Ayaṁ samādhi paccuppannasukho ceva āyatiñca sukhavipāko’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.4.en: ‘This immersion is blissful now, and results in bliss in the future.’ …

an5.27:1.5.pli: ‘ayaṁ samādhi ariyo nirāmiso’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.5.en: ‘This immersion is noble and not of the flesh.’ …

an5.27:1.6.en: ‘This immersion is not cultivated by reprobates.’ …

an5.27:1.7.pli: ‘ayaṁ samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhaladdho ekodibhāvādhigato, na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.7.en: ‘This immersion is peaceful and sublime and tranquil and unified, not held in place by forceful suppression.’ …

an5.27:1.8.pli: ‘sato kho panāhaṁ imaṁ samāpajjāmi sato vuṭṭhahāmī’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati.
an5.27:1.8.en: ‘I mindfully enter into and emerge from this immersion.’ …

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.27
3. With Five Factors
Immersion

dn34:1.6.70.pli: ‘ayaṁ samādhi paccuppannasukho ceva āyatiñca sukhavipāko’ti paccattaṁyeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati.
dn34:1.6.70.en: The following knowledges arise for you personally: ‘This immersion is blissful now, and results in bliss in the future.’

dn34:1.6.71.pli: ‘Ayaṁ samādhi ariyo nirāmiso’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati.
dn34:1.6.71.en: ‘This immersion is noble and not of the flesh.’

dn34:1.6.72.en: ‘This immersion is not cultivated by reprobates.’

dn34:1.6.73.pli: ‘Ayaṁ samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhaladdho ekodibhāvādhigato, na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato’ti paccattaṁyeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati.
dn34:1.6.73.en: ‘This immersion is peaceful and sublime and tranquil and unified, not held in place by forceful suppression.’

dn34:1.6.74.pli: ‘So kho panāhaṁ imaṁ samādhiṁ satova samāpajjāmi sato vuṭṭhahāmī’ti paccattaṁyeva ñāṇaṁ uppajjati.
dn34:1.6.74.en: ‘I mindfully enter into and emerge from this immersion.’

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn51.13:1.8.pli: Iti ayañca chando, ayañca chandasamādhi, ime ca padhānasaṅkhārā—
sn51.13:1.8.en: And so there is this enthusiasm, this immersion due to enthusiasm, and these active efforts.

sn51.13:2.6.pli: Iti idañca vīriyaṁ, ayañca vīriyasamādhi, ime ca padhānasaṅkhārā—
sn51.13:2.6.en: And so there is this energy, this immersion due to energy, and these active efforts.

sn51.13:3.6.pli: Iti idañca cittaṁ, ayañca cittasamādhi, ime ca padhānasaṅkhārā—
sn51.13:3.6.en: And so there is this mental development, this immersion due to mental development, and these active efforts.

sn51.13:4.6.pli: Iti ayañca vīmaṁsā, ayañca vīmaṁsāsamādhi, ime ca padhānasaṅkhārā—
sn51.13:4.6.en: And so there is this inquiry, this immersion due to inquiry, and these active efforts.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 51.13
2. Shaking the Stilt Longhouse
Immersion Due to Enthusiasm

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn54.9:6.3.pli: “ayampi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
sn54.9:6.3.en: “Mendicants, when this immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s peaceful and sublime, a delectable and blissful meditation. And it disperses and settles unskillful qualities on the spot whenever they arise.

sn54.9:7.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
sn54.9:7.2.en: In the same way, when this immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s peaceful and sublime, a delectable and blissful meditation. And it disperses and settles unskillful qualities on the spot whenever they arise.

sn54.9:8.4.pli: Evaṁ bhāvito kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi evaṁ bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasametī”ti.
sn54.9:8.4.en: That’s how this immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated so that it’s peaceful and sublime, a delectable and blissful  meditation. And it disperses and settles unskillful qualities on the spot whenever they arise.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 54.9
1. One Thing
At Vesālī

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an9.37:7.5.pli: Ayaṁ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṁphalo vutto bhagavatā’ti?
an9.37:7.5.en: What did the Buddha say was the fruit of this immersion?’

an9.37:8.4.pli: Ayaṁ, bhagini, samādhi aññāphalo vutto bhagavatā’ti.
an9.37:8.4.en: The Buddha said that the fruit of this immersion is enlightenment.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9.37
